intro: Catevala humilis, commonly known as the dwarf cat's eye, is a small, herbaceous plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, tubular flowers that are typically pale blue or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its delicate nature, it is not commonly cultivated outside its native habitat.
